body_html:
@samikama Thanks. 2) works now.

I would like to share with you current status of internal build. tf_gen_op_wrapper_py(name = "trt_engine_op", xxx) has building errors:

.../tensorflow/contrib/tensorrt/gen_trt_engine_op_py_wrappers_cc: error while loading shared libraries: libnvinfer.so.4: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

It'll take me some time to figure out why this works externally but not internally. This also cause failure of another two py_library named trt_ops_py and init_py. All other targets in contrib/tensorrt work well. So I'm wondering if we can split the failing targets out from this PR and submit the healthy ones first, and send another PR for those targets. In this way you can send future PRs in parallel (assuming you don't depend on the failing targets), and at least we can make some progress.

What do you think?

body:
@samikama Thanks. 2) works now.

I would like to share with you current status of internal build. `tf_gen_op_wrapper_py(name = "trt_engine_op", xxx)` has building errors:
```
.../tensorflow/contrib/tensorrt/gen_trt_engine_op_py_wrappers_cc: error while loading shared libraries: libnvinfer.so.4: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```
It'll take me some time to figure out why this works externally but not internally. This also cause failure of another two `py_library` named `trt_ops_py` and `init_py`. All other targets in contrib/tensorrt work well. So I'm wondering if we can split the failing targets out from this PR and submit the healthy ones first, and send another PR for those targets. In this way you can send future PRs in parallel (assuming you don't depend on the failing targets), and at least we can make some progress.

What do you think?
